question: Micro or Small Enterprise (as defined in the MSMED Act 2006) may be said to have become Sick, if?
option1: Any of the borrowal account of the enterprise remains NPA for ten months or more
option2: Any of the borrowal account of the enterprise remains NPA for eight months or more
option3: Any of the borrowal account of the enterprise remains NPA for five months or more
option4: Any of the borrowal account of the enterprise remains NPA for three months or more
answer: Any of the borrowal account of the enterprise remains NPA for three months or more
explanation: Micro or Small Enterprise (as defined in the MSMED Act 2006) may be said to have become Sick, if any of the borrowal account of the enterprise remains NPA for three months or more.
